questions.q: What can HTTP be used for?

choices.a: To load JSON data from a server
choices.b: To load the HTML for a website
choices.c: To load asset files, like JS, CSS, and images

questions.q:
In the following URL, what is `api.openweathermap.org` 
`http://api.openweathermap.org/data/2.5/weather?q=London`
Where in a HTTP request would be the best place put information about authentication?
What is the format most commonly used to communicate data between client and server?
What is not a valid value type in JSON data?
What does the PUT method mean in HTTP?
When is a callback function needed?

choices.a: When we aren't sure what function to call
choices.c: When a function has multiple steps

questions.q: What makes an asynchronous function different than a synchronous one?

choices.b: Synchronous function only do one thing
choices.c: Asynchronous functions happen next time the page is refreshed
choices.d: Asynchronous functions allow code to continue before completing
